result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte Christopher McAfee

records.addlTxt: State requests a new final pretrial date due to scheduling conflict.  Court rescheduled final pretrial.  Parties notified of new date.  Final pretrial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Deonte Christopher McAfee.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the Defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 10-25-2022 and all responses to be filed by 11-22-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed:  State's Requested Jury Instructions.

Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Deonte Christopher McAfee.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Stewart. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Deonte Christopher McAfee in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonte Christopher McAfee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
